text: Psalm 8
Yahweh’s Glory in Creation

For the \add music\add* director, on the Gittith.\f + \fr Ps 8 \ft Meaning uncertain \f* A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 8 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic \add is\add* your name in all the earth,
who put your splendor above the heavens.
From the mouth of children and infants you have founded\f + \fr 8:2 \ft Or “ordained” \f* strength
on account of your enemies,
to silence \add the\add* enemy and \add the\add* avenger.
When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers,
\add the\add* moon and \add the\add* stars which you set in place—
what \add is\add* a human being that you think of him?
and a child of humankind that you care for him?
And you made him a little lower than heavenly beings,\f + \fr 8:5 \ft Or “than God” \f*
and \add with\add* glory and \add with\add* majesty you crowned him.
You make him over the works of your hands;
all \add things\add* you have placed under his feet:
sheep and cattle, all of them,
and also \add the\add* wild animals of \add the\add* field,
\add the\add* birds of \add the\add* sky and the fish of the sea,
\add everything\add* that passes along the paths of seas.
Yahweh, our Lord,
how majestic \add is\add* your name in all of the earth!
